channel.title: Homes on Aaron Tohuvavohu
channel.description: Recent content in Homes on Aaron Tohuvavohu

item.title: Selected Talks
item.description: 2020 August: Invited tak at the Sustainable Cyber Infrastructure for Multi-messenger Astrophysics August meeting, on The Future of Treasure Map . July: Talk at Fast Radio Bursts 2020 titled Enabling Extremely Low Latency X-ray and UV followup of FRBs. January 29: Talk at the Canadian Multi-messenger Astrophysics Workshop titled 'Trying to solve the `first few hours` physics gap for compact binary mergers'. January: Talk at AAS #235 in Hawaii on Swift gamma-ray, x-ray, and UV follow-up to gravitational wave triggers in the 3rd LIGO/Virgo Observing Run

item.title: about
item.description: Email: (PGP public key) tohuvavohu <at> astro <dot> utoronto <dot> ca Physical address: 50 St. George St, Office 127 Toronto, ON M56 3H4 I am a graduate student in astrophysics at the University of Toronto, and an author for Astrobites. Previously I worked as an Observatory Duty Scientist for the NASA Swift satellite observatory based at Penn State. My current research focuses on multi-messenger astrophysics (with light, gravitational waves, and occasionally neutrinos), and fast or anomalous transients.
